description.compact: This Class creates an array of configurations for e-commerce.

docblock.description: This class replaces static variables in individual classes, such as Blog::$allow_wysiwyg_editing
docblock.see: # HOW TO USE IT 1. Copy ecommerce/_config/ecommerce.yml and move it your project folder, e.g. mysite/_config/ecommerce.yml In the copied file, set your configs as you see fit, using the YAML format. E.g. Order: Test: 1 Next, include in ecommerce.yml file: EcommerceConfig: folder_and_file_locations: - "mysite/_config/ecommerce.yml" - "myotherconfig.yaml" Then, in individual classes, you can access configs like this: EcommerceConfig::get("OrderAddress", "include_bla_bla_widget"); OR EcommerceConfig::get($this->ClassName, "include_bla_bla_widget"); if you are using PHP 5.3.0+ then you can write this in a static method EcommerceConfig::get("MyClassName", "include_bla_bla_widget"); Even though there is no direct connection, we keep linking statics to invidual classes. We do this to (a) group configs (b) make it more interchangeable with other config systems. One of the problems now is to know what "configs" are used by individual classes. Therefore, it is important to clearly document that at the top of each class.
